bugs

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • bugs.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser for the Bugs language, a project in CIT594, Spring 2015.
    Version:
    February 2015
    Author:
    Nicki Hoffman, Dave Matuszek

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.Stack<Tree<Token>> stack
      The stack used for holding Trees as they are created.

    • Method Detail

      • isAction

        public boolean isAction()
        Tries to build an <action> on the global stack. 
        <action> ::= <move action>
 | <moveto action>
 | <turn action>
 | <turnto action>
 | <line action>
        Returns:
        true if an action is recognized.

      • isAllbugsCode

        public boolean isAllbugsCode()
        Tries to build an <allbugs code> on the global stack. 
        <allbugs code> ::= "Allbugs"  "{" <eol>
 { <var declaration> }
 { <function definition> }
 "}" <eol>
        Returns:
        true if an allbugs code is recognized.

      • isAssignmentStatement

        public boolean isAssignmentStatement()
        Tries to build an <assignment statement> on the global stack. 
        <assignment statement> ::= <variable> "=" <expression> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if an assignment statement is recognized.

      • isBlock

        public boolean isBlock()
        Tries to build a <block> on the global stack. 
        <block> ::= "{" <eol> { <command> }  "}" <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a block is recognized.

      • isBugDefinition

        public boolean isBugDefinition()
        Tries to build a <bug definition> on the global stack. 
        <bug definition> ::= "Bug" <name> "{" <eol>
 { <var declaration> }
 [ <initialization block> ]
 <command>
 { <command> }
 { <function definition> }
 "}" <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a bug definition is recognized.

      • isColorStatement

        public boolean isColorStatement()
        Tries to build a <color statement> on the global stack. 
        <color statement> ::= "color" <KEYWORD> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a color statement is recognized.

      • isCommand

        public boolean isCommand()
        Tries to build a <command> on the global stack. 
        <command> ::= <action>
 | <statement>
        Returns:
        true if a command is recognized.

      • isComparator

        public boolean isComparator()
        Tries to build a <comparator> on the global stack. 
        <comparator> ::= "<" | "<=" | "=" | "!=" | ">=" | ">"
        Returns:
        true if a comparator is recognized.

      • isDoStatement

        public boolean isDoStatement()
        Tries to build a <do statement> on the global stack. 
        <do statement> ::= "do" <variable> [ <parameter list> ] <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a do statement is recognized.

      • isEol

        public boolean isEol()
        Tries to recognize an <EOL>. 
        <eol> ::= <EOL> { <EOL> }
        Returns:
        true if an EOL is recognized.

      • isExitIfStatement

        public boolean isExitIfStatement()
        Tries to build an <exit if statement> on the global stack. 
        <exit if statement> ::= "exit" "if" <expression> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if an exit if statement is recognized.

      • isFunctionCall

        public boolean isFunctionCall()
        Tries to build a <function call> on the global stack. 
        <function call> ::= <NAME> <parameter list>
        Returns:
        true if a function call is recognized.

      • isFunctionDefinition

        public boolean isFunctionDefinition()
        Tries to build a <function definition> on the global stack. 
        <function definition> ::= "define" <NAME> [ "using" <variable> { "," <variable> }  ] <block>
        Returns:
        true if a function definition is recognized.

      • isInitializationBlock

        public boolean isInitializationBlock()
        Tries to build an <initialization block> on the global stack. 
        <initialization block> ::= "initially" <block>
        Returns:
        true if an initialization block is recognized.

      • isLineAction

        public boolean isLineAction()
        Tries to build a <line action> on the global stack. 
        <line action> ::= "line" <expression> ","<expression> ","<expression> "," <expression> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a line action is recognized.

      • isLoopStatement

        public boolean isLoopStatement()
        Tries to build a <loop statement> on the global stack. 
        <loop statement> ::= "loop" <block>
        Returns:
        true if a loop statement is recognized.

      • isMoveAction

        public boolean isMoveAction()
        Tries to build a <move action> on the global stack. 
        <move action> ::= "move" <expression> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a move action is recognized.

      • isMoveToAction

        public boolean isMoveToAction()
        Tries to build a <moveto action> on the global stack. 
        <moveto action> ::= "moveto" <expression> "," <expression> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a move-to action is recognized.

      • isProgram

        public boolean isProgram()
        Tries to build a <program> on the global stack. 
         <program> ::= [ <allbugs code> ]
 <bug definition>
 { <bug definition> }
 <EOF>
        Returns:
        true if a program is recognized.

      • isReturnStatement

        public boolean isReturnStatement()
        Tries to build a <return statement> on the global stack. 
        <return statement> ::= "return" <expression> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a return statement is recognized.

      • isStatement

        public boolean isStatement()
        Tries to build a <statement> on the global stack. 
        <statement> ::= <assignment statement>
 | <loop statement>
 | <exit if statement>
 | <switch statement>
 | <return statement>
 | <do statement>
 | <color statement>
        Returns:
        true if a statement is recognized.

      • isSwitchStatement

        public boolean isSwitchStatement()
        Tries to build a <switch statement> on the global stack. 
        <switch statement> ::= "switch" "{" <eol>
 { "case" <expression> <eol>
           { <command> } }
 "}" <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a switch statement is recognized.

      • isTurnAction

        public boolean isTurnAction()
        Tries to build a <turn action> on the global stack. 
        <turn action> ::= "turn" <expression> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a turn action is recognized.

      • isTurnToAction

        public boolean isTurnToAction()
        Tries to build a <turnto action> on the global stack. 
        <turnto action> ::= "turnto" <expression> <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a turn-to action is recognized.

      • isVarDeclaration

        public boolean isVarDeclaration()
        Tries to build a <var declaration> on the global stack. 
        <var declaration> ::= "var" <NAME> { "," <NAME> } <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a var declaration is recognized.

      • isExpression

        public boolean isExpression()
        Tries to build an <expression> on the global stack. 
        <expression> ::= <arithmetic expression> {  <comparator> <arithmetic expression> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the add_operator is present but not followed by a valid <expression>.
        Returns:
        true if an expression is parsed.

      • isArithmeticExpression

        public boolean isArithmeticExpression()
        Tries to build an <expression> on the global stack. 
        <expression> ::= <term> { <add_operator> <expression> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the add_operator is present but not followed by a valid <expression>.
        Returns:
        true if an expression is recognized.

      • isTerm

        public boolean isTerm()
        Tries to build a <term> on the global stack. 
        <term> ::= <factor> { <multiply_operator> <term> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the multiply_operator is present but not followed by a valid <term>.
        Returns:
        true if a term is parsed.

      • isFactor

        public boolean isFactor()
        Tries to build a <factor> on the global stack. 
        <factor> ::= [ <unsigned factor> ] <name>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the opening parenthesis is present but not followed by a valid <expression> and a closing parenthesis.
        Returns:
        true if a factor is parsed.

      • isUnsignedFactor

        public boolean isUnsignedFactor()
        Tries to build an <unsigned factor> on the global stack. 
        <unsigned factor> ::= <variable> . <variable>
                    | <function call>
                    | <variable>
                    | <number>
                    | "(" <expression> ")"
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the opening parenthesis is present but not followed by a valid <expression> and a closing parenthesis.
        Returns:
        true if a factor is parsed.

      • isParameterList

        public boolean isParameterList()
        Tries to recognize a <parameter list>. 
        <parameter list> ::= "(" [ <expression> { "," <expression> } ] ")"
        Returns:
        true if a parameter list is recognized.

      • isAddOperator

        public boolean isAddOperator()
        Tries to recognize an <add_operator> and put it on the global stack. 
        <add_operator> ::= "+" | "-"
        Returns:
        true if an addop is recognized.

      • isMultiplyOperator

        public boolean isMultiplyOperator()
        Tries to recognize a <multiply_operator> and put it on the global stack. 
        <multiply_operator> ::= "*" | "/"
        Returns:
        true if a multiply_operator is recognized.

      • isVariable

        public boolean isVariable()
        Tries to parse a <variable>; same as <isName>. 
        <variable> ::= <NAME>
        Returns:
        true if a variable is parsed.
